author: eat food
subject: Re: That's it. I'm leaving.
body:
>> I've had it. Lupin stuff is too rare, and I don't like the
>> approach these other films take (anything past "Fuma Clan"), and
>> this  
>
>To each his own; some of the post-Fuma movies/specials are pretty
>good.

coughcoughWalthercoughcough...

>Both are good shows; never been able to get into
>Pokemon
>or Sailor Moon myself.  

Out of all the shows he's named Sailormoon is the only one I take a shine to. 

>The celluloid will set you back though;

*evil grin*

>you can
>find places that sell the raw Japanese tapes, but they are wicked
>expensive.

I found Lupin VS. Kuron and all the other movies in raw Japanese to rent at
this market I go to (whenever I want the latest Shonen Jump or some Pocky).
It's 5 bucks to rent, a little bit steep, but not much more expensive than a
fansub.....if only I can figure out some way to hook two vcrs together and
make a copy...

>*sigh*  That's the peril of the net, having to deal with clueless
>jerks.

I guess I'm a clueless jerk, complaining about cheesy jokes dubs add in that
aren't in the original.

>As for this list being barren, maybe all of us Lupin lovers are
>introverts. :)

Oh yeah, I'm a HUGE introvert! I picked work over my first date this summer.
Now that's antisocial.

>at best, we will get a subbed version of Cagliostro
>by the end of the year.

If we already don't have it subbed....(ask me, I will tell you where you can
still get it....I got my copy from this particular fansub distro)


-valerie 
http://members.tripod.com/~valerie
----------
Like rescuing precious stones that are confined in a safe...
It would be unjust to leave a girl here to be made a bride...
I will tell you the tale of the green fields.
This is the work of every thief.
-Lupin, Cagliostro no Shiro
